reviewText: UFO rocks the house in Dortmund, Germany, Nov. 29, 1980. The line up: Phil Mogg vocals, Pete Way bass, Andy Parker drums, Paul Chapman guitar, Neil Carter keyboards and guitar. Paul Raymond had recently departed for MSG, The Wild The Willing And The Innocent was already recorded but unreleased, and UFO were on a jaunt through the UK and Europe.This is a concert from that tour, with fine performances by all. If you like the Chapman era, get this DVD! The sound and picture are much improved over the editions floating around that appear to be unauthorized bootlegs (like the one I've been watching for years). This is from 1980, so it may not be up to some people's standards, but this is worth the money.The set list: Chains, Chains; Lettin' Go; Long Gone; Cherry; Only You Can Rock Me; No Place To Run; Makin' Moves; Love To Love; Mystery Train; Too Hot To Handle; Lights Out; Rock Bottom; Doctor, Doctor.People can debate till hell freezes over about the pros and cons of this line up (or any other in this band's long history). Michael Schenker wasn't the first or the last guitarist to play in UFO. I think every last one of them is great (Phil Mogg doesn't play with under achievers). If you only like Schenker don't buy this! Paul Chapman is brilliant here (and Neil Carter is an under appreciated talent as well). Great 30 year old concert from one of the very best bands in the world (in my opinion). The camera work is great, and these guys could teach a thing or two to these pups making concert videos now. I watched a Scorpions DVD that made me dizzy the camera moved around so much, never focusing on anyone for more than a few seconds. Not the case here. If you love UFO, you should enjoy the show.
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: DVD Live at Westfalenhalle Dortmund, Germany - November 29th 1980UFOPaul Tonka CHapman - guitarsPhil Mogg - vocalsPete Way - bassNeil Carter - keyboards, guitarsAndy Parker - drums01.) Lettin Go02.) Long Gone03.) Cherry04.) Only You Can Rock Me05.) No Place To Run06.) Making Moves07.) Love to Love08.) Mystery Train09.) Too Hot To Handle10.) Lights Out11.) Rock Bottom12.) Doctor DoctorThis is classic era UFO...I love the Schenker era, and the Chapman era is right up there too...so to me this is classic era...sure and the heck is worthier than that Misdemeanor tour DVD with Atomik Tommy on guitar.This is a fantastic concert...I mean, truly spot on, everyone is on 10...amazing show.  Glad I bought this...if you are a fan you will be too...I am not sure if this is a complete show...but considering the date of the show, it appears the majority of UFO first album with Paul Chapman and the UFO classics are properly represented.  So NO complaints here...Also, the picture and video and audio are all great...however, please give consideration that this was recorded 30 years ago...and it doesn't appear that any state-of-the-art remastering to the video was done, but don't let that hamper your decision to buy this everything is all good.A great release, you will enjoy...
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: Despite he loss of Michael Schenker the band continued to rock as well as ever. They did a super job in selecting Paul Chapman as the new guitarist. The new music continued to be excellent and there live performance did not suffer either. Phil Mogg is terrific and the band was as cohesive as ever. Chapman did a great job on the old songs and the new songs from No Place to Run were great. Great show. I purchased my copy from Amazon
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: Very nice concert DVD with no gimmicks in the recording. It would be nice to see some cute chicks though! Chapman can shred with the best.
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: One of the greatest rock bands ever!!  PHIL MOGG is perhaps rock & rolls most under rated singer!  Not the most heralded line up with Schenker, but having said that, Paul Chapman is amazing!  People don't ever give UFO the respect they earned and deserve!
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: Can't say enough about this DVD ... Phil Mogg & crew are stellar in this show ... playing just  about all of their best songs.  I am glad I made this purchase ... and any UFO fan will be also ...
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1

reviewText: Great concert from a show in Germany in November 1980 alot of songs from "No Place to Run" and "The Wild, The Willing and The Innocent" I wish they would play more songs from those albums today in concert.
Title: U.F.O. - Rockpalast: Hardrock Legends Vol.1
